YURI.raw_line: There are over 550 million firearms in worldwide circulation. That's one firearm for every twelve people on the planet. The only question is... ...how do we arm the other eleven?I was born Yuri Orlovitch in the city of Odessa in a country that no longer exists. You might have heard of it - a little place called the Soviet Union.All property is theft.Where I grew up, everyone was equal. Some were just more equal than others.Shortages? What shortages?My father was a wounded hero of World War Two, my younger brother was wounded in Afghanistan - a war without heroes. I'd gotten out of military service due to a heart problem - it wasn't completely a lie.And us.We're Jewish if we say we're Jewish.There have been few occasions in the twentieth century when it's been an advantage to be a Jew.The rubbing from the Jewish headstone was my first forged document. Little about my life has been kosher ever since.We Russian Jews were supposed to be headed for Israel but I didn't see much of the country on that first trip.Real Jews or fake Jews, eighty-five percent of us ended up in that other "promised land".We congregated in New York's Brighton Beach because of its similarity to the Crimean Sea. I've always thought it's appropriate we moved next door to the circus.I had no idea my father would take his assumed identity so much to heart. I guess he just stayed in character.I was suffering an identity crisis of my own.My gift for languages made me highly sought after. The C.I.A. and U.N. were both heavily recruiting Russian immigrants.Naturally, I went with the U.N. They were paying more.The fastest way to find out you can't change the world is to actually go there.West Africa's Liberia, or "land of the free", was originally established in the 1800's as a homeland for freed American negroes. It's been enslaved by one dictator or another ever since. They even copied their masters' Southern architecture.It was my first meeting with the American- educated Andre Roosevelt Baptiste. While the warning signs were all there, no one had any idea what a monster he would eventually become. I certainly didn't think he would become my friend.Orders.Doesn't look like a job for two men.It's not "bath of blood". It's, "blood bath".For the smile.Fuck, no, no, no, no--fuck, no. Money? You want money? Fuck, no. Don't shoot. Don't shoot me. Fuck. U.S. dollars. President Lincoln.What?No.No, keep it. Keep the money. Keep the gun.You want more Glocks?What makes you think I'll do that?You got any color preference for that?He'd come to the right place - peacekeepers are armed to the teeth. And nothing but premium product. The U.N. mostly buys from Switzerland - where else?Whatever you want.Would nothing be better?The starting salary for a U.N. interpreter back then was $32,000. I made fifty K on "misplaced" weapons on that one trip alone. I doubt the Secretary General noticed. The U.N. spends more on lunch.My tour as a peacekeeper was the perfect preparation for war.You know who's going to inherit the earth?That's the point. I've seen how the world's coming apart.You can't stop it. It's a basic human need - we eat, sleep, sleep with each other and what else? Fight. The oldest human skeletons have spearheads in their rib cages.I know which end I'd rather be on. Every day there are people shooting at each other. I think to myself, what guns are they using? Why not mine?Vitaly, I've tasted your borscht, you're no fucking chef. I can eat here for free and I still don't eat here. You're doing nothing with your life.That's why I need you. Brothers in arms.Yes.It wasn't God I was trying to get close to.Dad's contacts at synagogue landed me my first Israeli-made Uzis and an introduction to the biggest of the big guns.It was the eighties and the Cold War was far from thawed. Most of the deals were government-to-government. There were some go- betweens - freelancers - but it was a mostly private club with a lifetime club president.That's him. The guy Eli told me about. Simeon Zaharoff. Brokered deals in the Iran/Iraq war - both sides, sold missiles to Argentina in the Falklands. Hets a fucking legend. I've got to talk to him.Simeon! Simeon!A mutual friend, Eli Kurtzman from Brighton Beach Import-Export said to contact you. I have a business proposal. Perhaps we can discuss it - over a drink.Yob tvayu mat.Curious how you always revert to your native tongue in moments of extreme anger......and ecstacy.Vitaly and I found our niche in under-the- counter gunrunning - regimes suffering under sanctions.The job wasn't so different trom the U.N. I was just as neutral working for the ununited nations. An equal opportunity "merchant of death", I supplied every army but the Salvation Army.We got our start in Lebanon after the suicide bombing.When the United States leaves a war zone, they generally don't take their munitions. It costs more to bring it back than buy new stock.I sell by the kilo.For all my language skills, I soon discovered that what talks best is money. As long as you can speak dollars, dinars, drachmas, rubles, rupees, pesos, escudos, lira, krones, kwanzas, trancs, guilders, deutshmarks, yen and pounds-fucking- sterling, you can communicate anywhere in the world.This is bullshit money, Vit - small fucking potatoes.No. More illegal.It's not our fight.I sold Israeli-made Uzis to Muslims.I sold to both Pakistan and India in their fight tor the most inhospitable land on earth.How's it going?Make sure you thaw out the guns before you fight.We had our set-backs. It's not called gunrunning for nothing.Cannibal, what's going on?What?! What do you mean it's over?Friends?! You can't be fucking friends. Last week I spoke to you on the phone. You said you would not rest until every last rebel was dead. You called them vermin. You said would piss in their mouths, you said you would exterminate them like cockroaches. Just last week, you said this!Cannibal, don't you fucking walk away from me!Fuck you, Cannibal!!At least when they say they're going to have a war, they keep their word.I even shipped cargo to Afghanistan when they were still fighting fellow Russians. But I never sold to Osama bin Laden. Not for any moral grounds. Back then he was always bouncing checks.Personal use.I'm kind of trigger happy.And everywhere I went, Ava Cordova kept following me around. We were as international as each other.Operations like mine provided the only way for certain regimes to conduct a respectable war.The freighter I was standing on carried 113 tons of weapons and ammunition for delivery to one of the poorest nations in Latin America in direct contravention of half a dozen international arms embargoes.To keep authorities in the dark, I often spoke in code. Rocket launchers were "mothers", the rockets "children". Assault rifles were "apples". The AK-47 was "the Angel King".The Angel King will arrive tomorrow...Hallelujah to you too.No, no-one's going anywhere. Slow--dead slow. Buy me time.What?!What the fuck use is that?! He's painting a name registered in the fucking Netherlands!Turn it on its side.They say every man has his price - but not every man gets it. Interpol Agent, Jack Valentine, couldn't be bought, at least not with money. For Jack, glory was the prize.It's Yuri. Phone in a sighting of the Kristol south of Aruba.Nice job.Hey, pay before you play.No, you don't fuck him--The first and most important rule of gunrunning is never get shot with your own merchandise.The second rule is always ensure you have a foolproof way to get paid. Credit card, check, cash. Preferably in advance, ideally to an off-shore account. It's why I choose my customers so carefully. Say what you like about warlords and dictators, they tend to have a highly developed sense of order. They always pay their bills on time.I understand.What is this?I can't hand this to my fucking bank teller at Chase Manhattan.I sell guns. I don't sell drugs.I've got standards.Vit.I found Vitaly twelve days, two thousand miles and 150 grams later in a Bolivian boarding house.Vitaly! Open this fucking door!What the fuck is that?--You'll be fucking dead before you reach Kiev.Get out of the car.Vitaly, you're going to have a good time. This is a top place. Two Ford models checked in last week and that cute weather girl's been here since July.I never understood what separated the recreational drug user from the habitual, the functional addict from the dysfunctional. But for the grace of God, it could have been me snorting lines as long as the Belt Parkway.Vitaly never got completely clean despite the prayers of my mother......and father. In fact, my younger brother was the only reason my father ever had to question his new religion.After Colombia I became a one-man-operation. A sole proprietor as you say on your tax return - that is if you're foolish enough to fill one out.By then I'd mastered my craft. Selling arms is not so different to selling vacuum cleaners. You advertise, pound the pavement, take orders.Of course, a good arms dealer also has to be a political scientist. I go by a seven-step approach.One: identity a government and an opposition where the opposition is ignored.Two: Wait for a radical group to break away from the opposition.Three: Immediately approach the radical group and offer them arms.Four: Whether they buy or not, inform the government that the radical group approached you and offer the government arms.Five: Whether they buy or not, re-approach the radical group and offer them more arms but now at a higher price. Increasing tension is a means of generating demand and the ideal situation is to sell to both sides.Six: If they start shooting at each other, the escalation is underway.They are consuming small arms and ammunition and the cash register is well and truly ringing.Seven: Don't forget that the success of a radical group in one country can inspire a radical group in a neighboring country.The product? Er,...Colt .45. The beer.It cost me twenty for the fake booking, another twelve to buy out the hotel. You can't force someone to tall in love with you but you can sure make ita damn sight easier.Yuri Orlov. What brings you to St. Barts?Those things can come out of nowhere.You can hitch a ride with me if you like.In my experience some of the most successful relationships are founded on lies and deceit. Since that's where they usually end up anyway, it's a logical place to start.I nearly went broke trying to convince her I was anything but. I knew Ava was not the kind of woman to be seduced by a ride in a private jet unless you owned the jet.That is my name.Of course I was lying. The plane was a rental, like the car and even the suit I was standing in. At the last minute, I bribed the crew for the paint-job.Luckily, by the time we landed, Ava wasn't looking anywhere but in my eyes.I had no idea.At least you aren't taking them off.Nothing so glamorous. I'm in transport - international air freight mostly.Something like that.Like you, I can't complain.Well...I don't know. It's just that I travel all around the world but I can't help feeling sometimes that I'm going nowhere.I don't believe in fate.We married in a synagogue to make my father happy. In the eyes of my Catholic mother, it was worse than living in sin.It's traditional.Sure, Dad. A forty-thousand dollar crystal chandelier.I was still living way beyond my means, mortgaged to the hilt, using one credit card to payoff another. Anything to keep Ava in the style to which she had, thanks largely to me, become accustomed. Then suddenly all my Christmases came at once.Tak! Tak! Tak-fucking-tak!It's over! It's over!The Cold War, the Soviet Union, the Evil Empire. Mikhail's saying "no mas". He's throwing in the towel. It's over.I think I'll go back for a visit. Do you stay in touch with Uncle Dmitri?How is he?He's still a General in the army?He may be luckier than you think.You're only remembered when you're dead.I'm going back to Ukraine.I miss you too.There's no problem leading a double life. It's the triple and quadruple lives that get you in the end.Back then I carried a French, British, Israeli and Ukrainian passport and a student visa for the U.S., but that's another story.I also packed five different briefcases depending on the region of the world I was visiting.The end of the Cold War was the beginning of the hottest time in arms dealing. The Wall had fallen. The arms bazaar was open. Those forty-five years had generated the highest weapons build-up in history. The Soviets had tanks and guns coming out the demon hole - huge stockpiles and now no enemy.It's good to be home.0 - 60 in 4.8.--Report to who? Moscow? As of last week Moscow is in a foreign country.There is no new boss yet. They're too busy squabbling over who gets the presidential holiday home at the Black Sea.How many Kalashnikovs do you have?Is that a "4"? It doesn't look like a "4" to me. It looks more like a "1".It's whatever we say it is because no one else knows the difference.We'll cut them in. Anyway, what could happen - you're the luckiest man alive.Avtomat Kalashnikova, model of 1947 - more commonly known as the AK-47 or Kalashnikov. It's the world's most popular assault ritle - a weapon all fighters love. An elegantly simple nine pound amalgamation of forged steel and molded plastic. It doesn't break, jam or over-heat. It will shoot whether its covered in mud or filled with sand. It's so easy, even a child can use it. And they do. The Russians put the gun on a coin. Mozambique put it on their flag. Since the end of the Cold War, the Kalashnikov has become the Russian peoples' greatest export - after that comes vodka and suicidal novelists. One thing's for sure, no one was lining up to buy their cars.Of course my idea was not entirely unique. I had rivals.He's a friend of mine.You're late, Simeon.Maybe you'd like to come to my room and see my bazooka.You look a little lost, Simeon. Is the world changing too fast?Not all of you, I think.There's no place in gunrunning for politics anymore, Simeon. I sell to leftists, rightists. I'd sell to pacifists but they're not the most regular of customers.I think you are the amateur now. I think you suffer from a philosophical disadvantage - you have a philosophy. I think you should go with your instincts - your first instinct.Back then, it was all for sale...Helicopters, torpedo boats, armored personnel carriers, whole tank divisions.What about tech support?Son, get off there before you get hurt.He's twelve.Who are you?We have to go back.And start an international fucking incident - no, no, no.No. I've got paperwork.It's not a military helicopter. It's a rescue helicopter.Yuri Orlov.The crew called that vessel a lot of names - none of them repeatable in polite company.It's for humanitarian missions.Not any more.Didn't you get the memo? The war's over. What can they do with military hardware but convert to civilian use?The only way you could die from this baby is if a food drop hits you.But to a different client at a different address.Not complete, Sir. And while I hesitate to tell you your job, I must point out that when shipped separately the weapons and the aircraft both comply with the current Interpol trade standards and practices.I can see how certain people might interpret it as suspicious but thank God we live in a world where suspicion alone does not constitute a crime.I can hardly wait.What was he doing here?Don't worry. There're more VCR's. I left them in your new car.Dmit--!!!Ava--Sorry. I, er... How was your audition?Don't say that. You're good.Rough day at the office.Soon. How's Nicki?A party.I'd better go. I just wanted to call--hear your voice. Kiss Nicki for me.In Ukraine since 1992, $32 billion worth of arms have been stolen and re-sold. One of the greatest heists of the 20th Century.The primary market was Africa. Eleven major conflicts involving 32 countries in the past decade - a gunrunner's wet dream.My best customer was self-declared president of Liberia, Andre Baptiste. Even though we'd met before, I was in no hurry to meet him again. He'd gotten a reputation for routinely hacking off the limbs of those who opposed him. His seven-year civil war has been described as "a relentless campaign of sadistic, wanton violence unimaginable to those unfamiliar with the details of man's capacity to visit the abyss." That kind of sums up Andy for me.Thank him but I have other business. A busy schedule.What do you know? My schedule just freed up.But if I thought I was scared of Andre Senior, I knew I was scared of Andre Junior. Like father, like son. The guava doesn't fall too far from the tree. He was a heavy- drinker, a womanizer with a penchant for cheerleaders and a lover of fast American automobiles which he drove recklessly and with total impunity around the streets of the capital. Oh yes, he was also a cannibal. They say Andre would eat a victim's heart while it was still beating to give him superhuman strength. I could've told him he'd get the same effect from a pastrami sandwich at Carnegie's Deli.Monrovia itself was like being on another planet. Planet Monrovia. From the temperature it was obviously a planet close to the sun. I rarely saw another white man even at my hotel that was soon dubbed the "Little Kremlin". And I never left town alone. Outside town, was the edge of hell. I didn't want to even gaze into it.Part One, Two or Three?The M60. You want the attachable grenade launcher?In the most AIDS infested region of the globe, where one in four is infected, Andre's idea of a joke was to put a young Iman and a young Naomi naked in my bed and no condom within a hundred miles.How do you know?What if I have AIDS? Don't you worry?By leaving.--that's the Beretta, comes with a 36 cartridge, easy-operating clip--Now you're going to have to buy it. It's a used gun. I can't sell a used gun.I had heard of the "Boy Brigades", "Small Boy Units", "Kalashnikov Kids". The theory was that a bullet coming from a fourteen year old is just as effective as one trom a forty year old.You can't just look at the unit price. You forget the ancillary costs. End user certificates need to be forged and notarized, shell companies set up, insurance purchased, pilots and crews hired. Not to mention the bribes. You can't get a nut and bolt out of the Eastern bloc without a bribe. There's one bribe for the nut. Another for the bolt. This is an expensive proposition.I'll take the stones. It's hard to get a tree trunk in my hand luggage.I know you're planning a new offensive. If you delay a week I can get you the armored personnel carriers we talked about. They would give you a significant strategic advantage.It's not "lord of war". It's "warlord".Diamonds are far less bulky than hundred- dollar bills. You can get a million dollars into a cigarette box.By the mid-nineties, my wealth had caught up to my lies about my wealth - even surpassed the lies.Fantastic. Who bought it?You know. Same old, same old. Where's Nicki, in bed?I'll kiss him goodnight.What doesn't?I figured I was a patron of the arts and of everything else Ava had tried and failed at after modelling. Acting, her own cosmetics line. I didn't sabotage her careers but I can't deny it was convenient for me in maintaining a low profile. She was a beautiful bird in a gilded cage.How are you, brother?Someone has to do it.We don't talk about it.To Manet, Monet...and Ava Cordova.The trip went better than expected.I know just the outfit.I didn't know how much she knew and how much she ignored. I was a good provider and as far as she was concerned - loyal. Despite the other women, I always made love to Ava as if she was the only one.Take Park.This is good.I was now the best merchant of death alive. I didn't own my own plane. I owned a fleet - running guns into Liberia, Sierra Leone or the Ivory Coast at least once a week. Unfortunately, my friends at Interpol were also starting to find West Africa on the map. Most trips I had phoney paperwork. If the deadline was tight, I had no paperwork at all.Colonel Southern, it's Yuri. Sorry to call you on this number but I've got an Interpol jet and--Not a good time!Where was the first fucking warning?!You land and we're all going away! I don't have paperwork!Okay! Okay!--Fuck!!Not the airport. There. The highway. It's our only fucking hope.Don't underestimate yourself. You're the best, Tony.We're going to be okay.Wait, you idiots! There's not going to be any evidence! Stay with the plane!Help yourselves. Be my guest. No charge.What a fucking disaster.Hey, not those! You don't touch the plane! Not the fucking seats...What's the charge?I'm on safari.Are you with the park service? Hunting without a license - is that the charge?Trading. But without evidence who can say?I don't want people dead, Agent Valentine. I admit, a shooting war is better for business. But I'd prefer people to fire my guns and miss. Just as long as they're firing.Vivian...You know. Fighting the good fight.Uh, yes. In fact, I've just had some transport problems. You couldn't give me a ride to Monrovia, could you?Jesus! Simeon!Me?!You stupid old fuck!No.No. No. I...Stop.I started doing a lot of cocaine in West Africa. I wasn't medicating myself. I was simply playing catch-up. I was constantly dealing with people who are chemically imbalanced without the aid of chemicals. It's just a matter of etiquette. It's rude to act sane in a room full of lunatics.What?What is it?What does the gunpowder do?Some other time.Why?I'm going for a walk.I didn't fuck you, did I? Did I fuck you?Are you sick?Hello.Simeon.Yeah, fuck Andre.I'm sorry. They don't usually do that. Let me have a look. Maybe I can fix it.Not bad. Andre's latest double?He's too eloquent.More good news. That's the last aid shipment. The war is so bad, the U.N. is pulling out.There are trucks. You just have to get all that food out of them.After surviving the last few days I'd started to feel like I was invincible. But there was a weapon that could hurt me.Ava?Ava, what's wrong? Where's Nicki?Why aren't you dressed? I thought we were going out.Don't be so melodramatic.Why? We never have before.These people - you can't trust them--I sell people a means to defend themselves, Ava. That's all. I don't hold a gun to any one's head and make them shoot----I don't sell machetes.There's nothing illegal about what I do.It makes no difference if I stop. Someone will take my place the next day.--It's not about the money.You can't leave. I'll stop. I'll stop.Yes. Now get dressed. We'll go out.For the next month I stopped running guns. I went legitimate.No wonder Valentine was confused.Thank God there are still legal ways to exploit developing countries.But the only problem with an honest buck is they're so hard to make. The margins are too low. Too many people are doing it.--Impossible. Two and a quarter? I can't make a profit at two and a quarter. Why don't you take my oil and I'll fucking pay you?He's early.What the fuck are you doing here, Andre?So at the same time you thought you'd drop in on your arms dealer?!I--They've got to be watching.--hunt for a witch?I can't help you. I'm sorry.Both. Everything.At four and a half months a human fetus has a reptile's tail - a remnant of our evolution.You can fight a lot of enemies and survive but if you fight your biology you always lose.Hey, not even waiting to say goodbye? I'm leaving in ten minutes.See you, big guy.This oil concession should be wrapped up by Thursday. I'll be back for the weekend. We'll go somewhere - the sea.You trust me, right?She looked me directly in the eye the way I've looked in the eyes of a thousand customs officials, government bureaucrats and footsoldiers from every law enforcement agency in the world - and she lied without flinching.She'd learned from the best.I can always sense when I'm being tailed. I know what to look for. But then I'd never been tailed by the woman I love.I can put myself in Ava's place. She might have understood if the combination was the last four digits of my social, my birthdate, even her birthdate but not Nicolai's.My son's birthday unlocked what the government would later describe as, "a catalogue of carnage".I miss your borscht. Mom and Dad say you're clean.That's because it's not true.Only you know. I'm leaving tonight - on a job. I want you to come.Maybe this trip will help. It's good money.They don't have to know. We'll tell them we're going for a little "r" and "r".West Africa's fucked-up. More than usual. I can't trust anybody. I need someone to watch my back.Where are we going?Every faction in Africa calls themselves by these noble names - "liberation-this", "patriotic-that", "democratic-republic-of- something or other". I guess they can't own up to what they usually are - "federation- of-worse-oppressors-than-the last-bunch-of- oppressors". Often the most barbaric atrocities occur when both combatants proclaim themselves "freedom fighters".Not now.Excuse me.What?The fuck we can't.It's not our business.There is no hold up. I'll be right there.What do you think they'll do if we back out - they'll kill us.Nothing.Vit!!Vitaly broke the cardinal rule of gunrunning. Never pick up a gun and join the customers.Coffins are hard to come by in Sierra Leone. Demand is so high. Fortunately, we had a lot of boxes just the right size.I don't know which is worse, Jewish guilt or Catholic guilt. My parents were like God's tag-team.But I could not deny them the chance to say goodbye to their eldest son.For twenty Monrovian dollars a doctor removed the lead from Vitaly's body and wrote a bogus death certificate. I should have paid more.I've smuggled millions of rounds of ammunition and the bullet that lands me in jail is found under my dead brother's rib.Believe it or not, I only use the first two.Papa?Maybe he did. If I saw one of those coming at me, l'd have heart failure.Falsifying a death certificate? That's not going to hold me.Enjoy it.This. Tell me that I am everything you despise, that I am the personification of evil, that I'm responsible for the breakdown of the social fabric of society and world order, that I am a one man genocide. Say everything you want to say to me now - because you don't have long.My family has disowned me. My wife and son have left me. My brother is dead. Trust me, I fully appreciate the seriousness of my situation. But I promise you I won't spend a single second in a courtroom.I like you, Jack. Well, maybe not. But I understand you. You feel your loyalty to your badge has finally been rewarded. But you haven't counted on the people who gave you that badge.In the hall there will be a man who outranks you.First, he will compliment you on the fine job you've done, how you're making the world a safer place and then he is going to tell you that I am to be released.You are going to protest, you will probably threaten to resign.But in the end I will be released.The reason I'll be released is the same reason you think I will be convicted. I do rub shoulders with the most vile, sadistic men calling themselves leaders today. But some of those men are the enemies of your enemies.What if I'm not? What if I sleep fine at night? What if I sleep better than you? I think that's what truly scares you.Most people are happy just to get out of jail. I expect to be paid to leave.I'm not a fool. I know that just because they need me one day doesn't mean they won't make me a scapegoat the next. But I was back doing what I do best.Sun umbrellas.For someone who's never fired a gun or been in a battle, I have suffered many casualties in my life. I guess that's how I survived. I never went to war...

AVA.raw_line: Baby blue. My favorite color!I don't know if you'll be taking me to bed tonight, darling, but you can take her.Popular hotel, huh?A photo shoot. At least, that was the plan. But the photographer's plane got stuck in Miami. Hurricane - though there was nothing in the news.The job's cancelled and there's no flight back to New York 'til Tuesday.This is your plane?Don't apologize. I put on clothes for a living.I would be if half the photographers had their way. But I can't complain. I'm paid to say, "Cheese". What about you?What, like UPS or something?Business is good.But if you did?This is no accident, is it, Yuri?What do you believe in?Yuri likes to spoil you.Nicki! You did it. Good boy!Yuri. Don't you want to see what your son is doing?What's over?That's nice. Your son is crawling.Yes, I'll accept the charges.Hey, baby. You forgotten what time it is?They're going in another direction. The direction of someone who can act.And you're biased.Where are you? Is everything okay?Come home. We miss you.Asleep in our bed. It's lonely without you.It's always a party where you are.I love you.Yuri, I just got off the phone with the dealer. I sold my first painting.Someone important. They want to remain anonymous. How was your trip?I'm sorry. Poor darling. He tried to stay up.My first painting. I'm officially an artist!Yuri!Yuri, they're beautiful. But what am I going to wear them with?Vitaly...it's Ava.Hush, Nicki. I don't believe you.Get out.He's with your parents.I can't wear the clothes. I can't wear the jewelry. I can't drive the car. I can't live in this house. Everything1s got blood on it.Of course I'm melodramatic. I'm a failed actress, remember? We need to talk about it.Now we do.--I've talked to your parents. Sierra Leone----What do you think is pointing at the victims when they use those machetes? I see the pictures. Yuri, the guns are bigger than the boys.I don't care if it's legal, it's wrong.Please stop.Let them. We have enough. You promise?Yuri, the President of Liberia is in the lobby.Was that about the oil or the timber?Sorry, Nicki has swim practice.Personally, I'm glad you're going. You've been here so long you're starting to get on my nerves.That would be fun.Yes, I trust you.That's him.It's a game.Yes.Not that. Not that, Yuri.
